org.apache.zab

Class QuorumZab

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.zab.Zab
      • org.apache.zab.QuorumZab
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, ServerState, Transport.Receiver

    public class QuorumZab
extends Zab
implements ServerState, Transport.Receiver, Runnable
    Quorum zab implementation. This class manages the quorum zab servers. For each server, it can be in one of three states : ELECTING, FOLLOWING, LEADING. Among all the nodes, there's only one server can be established leader.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Stores the statistics about follower.

    • Field Detail

      • transport

        protected Transport transport
        Used for communication between nodes.

      • proposedEpoch

        protected int proposedEpoch
        The last received proposed epoch. Corresponds to f.p in Zab paper.

      • acknowledgedEpoch

        protected int acknowledgedEpoch
        The last acknowledged epoch received. Corresponds to f.a in Zab paper.

      • stateChangeCallback

        protected org.apache.zab.QuorumZab.StateChangeCallback stateChangeCallback
        Callback interface for testing purpose.

      • messageQueue

        protected BlockingQueue<org.apache.zab.QuorumZab.MessageTuple> messageQueue
        Message queue. The receiving callback simply parses the message and puts it in queue, it's up to leader/follower/election module to take out the message.

      • send

        public void send(ByteBuffer message)
          throws IOException
        Description copied from class: Zab
        Sends a message to Zab. Any one can call call this interface. Under the hood, followers forward requests to the leader and the leader will be responsible for broadcasting.
        Specified by:
        send in class Zab
        Parameters:
        message - message to send through Zab
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of IO failures

        Parameters:

      • onReceived

        public void onReceived(String source,
              ByteBuffer message)
        Callback which will be called from transport layer when a message is received. This callback may be called from different thread for different sources, so we should be aware of the race condition.
        Specified by:
        onReceived in interface Transport.Receiver
        Parameters:
        source - the source of the message.
        message - the ByteBuffer which contains the protocol buffer message.
